sentence.text: I pushed in a couple of pessaries , untied the sack from my middle and pulled my shirt over my head .
He turned her to face him , then untied the silk from her eyes , letting it fall to the ground .
We pulled off the sheets and untied the prisoner from the post .
He stood up and untied his now-biddable horse from a sapling .
A darker cloud bowled over the sun , bringing a sudden icy wind , and he paused to untie his Fair Isle sweater from his waist and put it on .
In fact , you 're a girl who 's going places -- once you 've untied yourself from this man who 's been like a millstone around your neck for the last four years .
She untied the sleeves of her sweater and began to pull it on over her head , aware as she did so of a faint muffled sound behind her .
The blindfolds were removed and their ankles were untied but it was minutes before they could stand , much less walk .
We had to calm her and untie my father , laying him down tenderly while we tried to extricate the mule .
The khthons had untied them and left a torch before locking the dungeon door .
The boatman was untying the guest-line .
Without another word , Seb untied the mare 's reins , mounted and rode away .
The old Egyptian remedy , apparently was to drink beer from an old shoe , which is why I 'm sitting here untying my laces .
She crouched over the bag , untied the knotted corners and peered in .
She moved from his arms and slowly untied her leather apron .
She untied the sticks and rubbed them together between her palms .
He spread an artist 's folio before her , untied the ribbons with delicate fingers , and invited her to lay it open .
The Galks untied the travellers , bowed to the throne and retreated .
Bardsley untied his apron and hung up the tea cloth that , appropriately enough in this flat , was a large linen facsimile of a pound note .
Trung untied the cord and wound it around his waist to return later to the overseer .
